perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement is for ten (10) years commencing on the date of this Agreement, unless terminated as provided by this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement is for ten (10) years commencing on the date of this Agreement. However, the agreement may be terminated early at any time, with or without cause, provided the franchisee is given a 30-day notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a ten-year term 'unless terminated as provided by this Agreement,' implying specific termination clauses govern. The modified version introduces a contradictory clause allowing termination 'at any time, with or without cause,' overriding the initial term and potentially conflicting with other termination clauses in the agreement. This creates ambiguity about the actual length and conditions of the franchise term.

perturbation.original_text: We may from time to time advise or offer guidance to you relative to prices for the food and other products offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant that in our judgment constitute good business practice. Such guidance will be based on our experience in operating and franchising Restaurants and an analysis of the costs of such products and prices charged for competitive products.  You will not be obligated to accept any such advice or guidance and shall have the sole right to determine the prices to be charged from time to time by the Franchised Restaurant and no such advice or guidance shall be deemed or construed to impose upon you any obligation to charge any fixed, minimum or maximum prices for any product offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant.  We may from time to time establish promotional practices which you are required to follow such as "free refill," "buy one and get one free" or similar practices.
perturbation.changed_text: We may from time to time advise or offer guidance to you relative to prices for the food and other products offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant that in our judgment constitute good business practice.  Such guidance will be based on our experience in operating and franchising Restaurants and an analysis of the costs of such products and prices charged for competitive products. You will not be obligated to accept any such advice or guidance and shall have the sole right to determine the prices to be charged from time to time by the Franchised Restaurant and no such advice or guidance shall be deemed or construed to impose upon you any obligation to charge any fixed, minimum or maximum prices for any product offered for sale by the Franchised Restaurant. We may from time to time establish promotional practices which you are required to follow such as "free refill," "buy one and get one free" or similar practices. You agree that all prices and promotional practices must align with overall brand strategy as determined by us, which will be provided to you on an annual basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants the franchisee sole discretion in setting prices but then requires them to follow promotional practices set by the franchisor. The modification adds that all prices and promotional practices must align with the overall brand strategy. This creates a contradiction: While the franchisee has the right to set prices, they must align with the brand strategy, which could effectively dictate price ranges and limit the franchisee's autonomy. This ambiguity leads to uncertainty about pricing control.

perturbation.original_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing.  You will retain for a period of three (3) years all books and records related to the Franchised Restaurant, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers.  If a computerized accounting system is developed by us for use throughout the franchise System, you will at your expense implement and utilize such a system according to the standards and procedures established by us.
perturbation.changed_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing. You will retain for a period of one (1) year all books and records related to the Franchised Restaurant, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers. If a computerized accounting system is developed by us for use throughout the franchise System, you will at your expense implement and utilize such a system according to the standards and procedures established by us.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the franchisee to retain all relevant bookkeeping items for three years, while the altered version reduces this time to only one year. This creates a contradiction in the amount of time that the franchisee needs to retain important documents that may be relevant to the franchise, such as for tax and revenue reconciliation or in the event of a legal dispute. The inconsistency puts the franchisee in a position where they are simultaneously in and out of compliance, dependent on which section of the contract is being followed.
